creator: dlr@finemaltcoding.com
text:
StandardManager's maxInactiveInterval is ignored in my Catalina setup with the
20020124 HEAD nightly. build

    <context ...>
        ...
        <Manager maxInactiveInterval="2" debug="1"/>
    </context>

StandardContext's sessionTimeout is also ignored:

    <context sessionTimeout="2" ...>
        ...
    </context>

I have only had success with setting the session timeout in the web application
deployment descriptor:

    <session-config>
        <session-timeout>2</session-timeout>
    </session-config>

Also, I couldn't tell which of these 3 ways was the recommended method for
setting a session timeout (assuming that all three actually do just that).  It
looks like some are used as overrides and other as baselines, but the
documentation was nearly non-existant.  If someone can clarify this for me, I'll
submit the appropriate xdoc changes.

Note that I have custom Valve implementations that manipulate Sessions using the
Catalina API.  However, since the session-config/session-timeout property works
for me, I'd be hesitant to say that this custom Valve is affecting things.

creator: bob@jadn.com
text:
Verified in 4.1.5    The only current way to set the session timeout is in the
web.xml of the app, or modify the "system" web.xml in the config directory.
Setting Context or Manager is pointless because the web.xml (or web.xml's
default values if no sessionTimeout is provided) will overwrite the other settings.

Not sure what to do about this.

Cheers,
-bob

creator: dlr@finemaltcoding.com
text:
Robert, what you say reflects the behavior that I've been seeing.

If the ability to set the session timeout using a Context or Manager is not
easily fixable, perhaps their attributes for doing so should be deprecated
(@deprecate the appropriate Java code, and have Catalina log a warning when
someone attempts to use them).  I haven't looked at the code for a while;
perhaps it is possible to make these attributes usable.

I updated the session manager's TC5 documentation to remove mentioning the 
maxInactiveInterval attribute (since setting it is pointless.)
creator: bob@jadn.com
dlr@finemaltcoding.com
